thread.title: Five Best: Jon Meacham on America’s Hours of Crisis

author: Jon Meacham
title: Five Best: Jon Meacham on America’s Hours of Crisis
text:
The Legacy of the Civil War By Robert Penn Warren (1961)
1. On the centennial of Fort Sumter, poet-novelist-critic Robert Penn Warren wrote this short but penetrating book positing that the war had given the South the “Great Alibi” and the North a “Treasury of Virtue.” “Even now,” he wrote, “any common lyncher becomes a defender of the Southern tradition, and any rabble-rouser the gallant leader of a thin gray line of heroes.” Did the Southerner “howling vituperation at a little Negro girl being conducted into a school building...
